intro: Pleurospermum golaka, commonly known as the Golak mountain wormwood, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Pleurospermum golaka is valued in traditional medicine for its potential anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic effects.
